result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Robbins requests that a status conference into the new year. No objection by any parties. Court schedules Status Conference. Atty Robbins makes statement of a scheduling between Attys out of court.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Transcript from 3/28/22 Preliminary hearing

10:21 AM Defendant Samantha S. Smith appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County.  Attorney James S Robbins appeared by video for Samantha S. Smith. Attorney Chad D Verbeten in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appears by video in court for State of Wisconsin. Judge Anthony Stella Jr. appears by video from Iron County.  Court calls case  and recites appearances.   Attny Robbins acknowledges information, waives reading.  Attorney Robbins enters NG Plea to all counts.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.   State does not object to setting a status conference.  All parties agree, Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Smith appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail, with Atty James S Robbins appearing by video. records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF APPEARANCE OF CO-COUNSEL
Arraignment on April 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

08:23 AM Defendant Domenic Robert Falkner in court with attorney Erika L Bierma.  Defendant Samantha S. Smith in court with Attorney James S. Robbins.  Defendant Domenic Robert Falkner in custody and Defendant Samatha S Smith in custody.  Attorney General Chad Verbeten appears in court for the State.  Court calls cases 22CF87 and 22CF88 and recites appearances for both cases.  Court makes statement to the gallery as to recording devices not allowed, unless filing written request and approved, court directs everyone to turn off electronic devices, if any devices go off, they will be confiscated.  Attny Robbins places objection on the record as to holding preliminary hearing today and request for dismissal and refilling of case.  Attny Bierma no argument to Attny Robbins objection, but makes statement regarding still photography.  AG Verbeten makes argument as to objection by Attny Robbins.    Attny Robbins continues arguments.  Court is aware of the time limits and makes statement, and court over ruled Mr. Robbins objection.   Court continues with preliminary hearing.    AG Verbeten calls witness City of Hayward Assistant Chief Wohling,  Court sworn in witness.  AG Verbeten begins examination.    8:38 AM  Witness identified the DEF Samantha Smith,  Attny Robbins no objection,  court indicates the record will reflect.  AG Verbeten continues examination.   8:38 AM  Witness identified the DEF Domenic Faulkner,  Attny Bierma no objection, court indicates the record will reflect.  AG Verbeten continues examination.  Court interrupts for clarification of dates.  AG Verbeten continues examination.   8:51 AM  AG Verbeten no further questions.   8:51 AM  Attny Robbins cross-examination.     8:51  AG Verbeten objection, already asked and answered.     Attny Robbins rephrase question.   Attny Robbins continues cross-examination.  Attny Robbins no further questions.   8:53 AM  Attny Bierma cross-examination.    8:54 AM   AG Verbeten - objections, Calls for conclusions -  Court address Attny Bierma, discussion takes place -   Court allows Attny Bierma to proceed.   Attny Bierma continues cross examination.    Attny Bierma no further questions.  8:58 AM  Witness excused.    No further witness by either party.   State makes argument and  request for bind over.   Attny Robbins makes argument.   Attny Bierma makes argument and doesn't believe state has met probable cause.   Court makes statement, and  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Court questions Asst A.G. Verbeten, Asst. A.G. Verbeten responds, indicating criminal complaint will be consistent with PC statement.
